alert.note: Alert for San Bernardino (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS LasVegas (Southern Nevada, Southeastern California, Northwestern Arizona)
info.headline: Dust Storm Warning issued April 11 at 12:35PM PDT until April 11 at 1:30PM PDT by NWS LasVegas
info.description: ...A DUST STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 130 PM PDT FOR NORTH CENTRAL SAN BERNARDINO COUNTY... At 1231 PM PDT, a dust plume continued to be observed from north of Yermo northwest to Mountain Pass and just west of the Interstate 15 corridor. HAZARD...Less than one quarter mile with damaging wind gusts up to 60 mph. SOURCE...Detected by satellite observations and reports from local officials. IMPACT...Dangerous and sudden reductions in visibility making driving very hazardous. Very strong cross winds could also result in blow overs or sudden lane changes for high profile vehicles. This includes Interstate 15 in California between mile markers 139 and 158 as well as highway 127 from Baker to the county line. Locations impacted include... Baker and Tecopa. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Motorists should not drive into a dust storm. PULL ASIDE STAY ALIVE! To report severe weather, contact the National Weather Service, or your nearest law enforcement agency, who will relay your report to the National Weather Service office in Las Vegas.
